data.text: @stephens_ben Not familiar with him and seems for the best maybe?

@sen_68kylie Taken in isolation that is a cogent point and I wouldn't have commented on it if it hadn't come from James "Just Asking Questions" Melville, who has been stoking Covid-denial narratives for some time and may now be pivoting to both-sides-ing the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
@stephens_ben I think that’s what is being said in that tweet

@stephens_ben In conflict and war it is majority the working class and those with the least power in society who die and kill. Who have immediate and intergenerational trauma. It operates significantly along class divisions.
@stephens_ben Also what is he trying to say or prove here? That pharma and financiers manufactured Covid? That we ignore Ukraine? He just likes making erroneous statements sometimes for the Likes.
@stephens_ben I’m sorry, his dog whistling is causing me hearing difficulties.

Also, I imagine there are people in the first six categories who consider it a loss even if none of these things happen to them and only happen to other people.

You see, James, some people can conceive of a wider world beyond themselves. Wild, right?
